item.title: Report X-2023081924
item.description:
Report X-2023081924

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG, FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS COROSIVE. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE AND USED THE NEUTRALIZER TO ABSORB THE SUBSTANCE. ONCE IT WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE PLASTIC PAIL HAS A TINY HOLE IN IT. LOOKS LIKE IT WAS SCRATCHED ON THE BOTTOM OF THE PAIL PRIOR TO BEING PACKED IN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER.

item.title: Report X-2023081849
item.description:
Report X-2023081849

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-24
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ON THE IC BELT AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN BACK TO QA AND PROCESSED. DescribePack: BOTH BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM ARTOUND THE CAPS AND SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023081847
item.description:
Report X-2023081847

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081847 SequenceEvent: Package was found on the unload and was called out by a manager DescribePack: The liquid leaked through a crack in the container DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a tote with a liner, the spill was cleaned with absorb all and neutralizer. 2. X-2023081852 SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTIFIED QA OF THE PEAKING PACKAGE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ALL FOUR BOTTLES WERE LEAKING AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023081826
item.description:
Report X-2023081826

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a package handler was unloading a trailer, he noticed that a pacakge was wet and he told to his manger. DescribePack: The gallon got punctured and about 5 ounces of the contents spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manger called QA and QA went to the area with a red tote line with a hazmat bag. we brought to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2023082015
item.description:
Report X-2023082015

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE HANDLER DROPPED THE PACKAGE OFF OF THE IC BELT CAUSING IT TO LEAK OUT. MANAGER NOTIFIED QA AND QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE. THE SPILL WAS CLEANED UP AND PACKAGE WAS TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE METAL PAIL WAS LEAKING OUT FROM THE BUNGHOLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023081662
item.description:
Report X-2023081662

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLERS WERE PULLING THE ICS OFF THE BELT, THEY PICKED UP THIS PACKAGE AND SET IT ON THE ROLLERS AND THEY STARTED FEELING A TINGLEY SINSATION IN THIER HANDS. THEY IMMEDIATELY INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION AND ALSO INFORMED THEM THEY DID NOT KNOW WHICH PACKAGE IT CAME FROM. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH A TOTE LINED WITH HAZBAG AND NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB. UPON ARRIVAL, QA NOTICED THE 5 GALLON BUCKET ON THE ROLLERS AND NOTICED IT WAS LEAKING OUT THRU THE AIR HOLE IN THE CAP. THEY PLACED IT IN THE TOTE AND INFORMED THE MANAGER WHICH PACKAGE IT CAME FROM. QA BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE FELL OVER ON THE BELT AND THE CONTENTS LEAKED OUT THRU THE MIDDLE OF THE CAP (AIR HOLE). DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACAKGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZBAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER AND FOLD ABSORB.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While the package was on the IC belt one, one package handler found it the fell of and was leaking. he told to his manger. DescribePack: One gallon got crushed and loose cap and one of the contents spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manager put the package in a tote and called QA. QA went the area and take care of it.

item.title: Report E-2023090389
item.description:
Report E-2023090389

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of bleachstone(1263) had one inner metal one gallon can damaged by a sharp object and had released 2 quarts of product and that one case of retarder(1263) had one of the inner metal on gallon can also damaged by a sharp object had released 2 quarts of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023081513
item.description:
Report X-2023081513

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-19T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-06
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THIS PAIL WAS ON ITS SIDE WHEN THEY WENT TO RETRIEVE IT FROM THE TRAILER. THEY PICKED IT UP AND NOTICED RIGHT AWAY THIS WAS LEAKING OUT AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA WITH A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED THE TOTE INSIDE OF IT. DescribePack: THE LIQUID WAS LEAKING OUT THRU THE MIDDLE OF THE CAP WHEN IT WAS TIPPED OVER. THE CAP ITSELF IT ON TIGHT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND BROUGHT BACK TO QA.
